result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond T Swerdon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases heard: 14CF465, 14CT192, 14CM497, Defendant Raymond T Swerdon in court with attorney David W. Franker.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to count 5 & 7 in 14CF465. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 yrs. probation, Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample, $518 & $443 costs. Bond applied to restitution in 14CM497, balance on court costs. (86 days jail credit).   Nolo plea in 14CM497 to cts. 2 & 5, 2 yr. probation, Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. $453 costs on each count. 15 days jail on each count, consecutive to each other, start 3/6/15 at 7 p.m. Huber granted for work, counseling and medical treatment, $353.75 restitution. Bond applied to restitution & court costs. (27 days jail credit) 14CT192 and all other cts. in both cases read in and dismissed.

Defendant Raymond T Swerdon by video, in custody with attorney David W. Franker in court.  Court called at 2:59 pm.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arguments made by defense and state.  Court denied motion to modify bond.  Court adjourned at 3:08 pm.
